item.title: search under cursor in vim
item.description: here's a vim tip i've learned recently let's say you want to search other occurences of a keyword in that case, just press * and then n to move forward and N (that's capital N) to move backwards keep in mind vim's definition of keyword, ie spider-man is considered 2 words in that (and other more advanced) cases, you may want to use visual selection unfortunately it's not as straightforward as we would want, but here's how it is done:
